member.summary: The clock always matches the system clock.

member.summary: The clock advances by the elapsed system time between ticks, multiplied by a user specified value.

member.summary: The clock advances by a fixed step each tick.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.AlignedAxisCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the axis specified as a unit Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in world coordinates in meters. If the array has three elements, the eye offset is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.AlignedAxisCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the axis specified as a unit Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in world coordinates in meters. If the array has three elements, the eye offset is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.AlignedAxisCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian},System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.
The index of the first element to use in the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.OpenEyeOffsetProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the eyeOffset property. The eyeOffset property defines the eye offset of the billboard, which is the offset in eye coordinates at which to place the billboard relative to the `position` property. Eye coordinates are a left-handed coordinate system where the X-axis points toward the viewer's right, the Y-axis points up, and the Z-axis points into the screen.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.WriteEyeOffsetProperty(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes a value for the eyeOffset property as a cartesian value. member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.OpenImageProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the image property. The image property defines the image displayed on the billboard, expressed as a URI. For broadest client compatibility, the URI should be accessible via Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS). The URI may also be a data URI.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.OpenScaleProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the scale property. The scale property defines the scale of the billboard. The scale is multiplied with the pixel size of the billboard's `image`. For example, if the scale is 2.0, the billboard will be rendered with twice the number of pixels, in each direction, of the `image`.

The default is the zero vector, which means the billboard is aligned to the screen up vector.

Eye coordinates are a left-handed coordinate system where the X-axis points toward the viewer's right, the Y-axis points up, and the Z-axis points into the screen.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.HorizontalOriginWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the horizontalOrigin property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The horizontalOrigin property defines the horizontal origin of the billboard. It controls whether the billboard image is left-, center-, or right-aligned with the `position`.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.ImageWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the image property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The image property defines the image displayed on the billboard, expressed as a URI. For broadest client compatibility, the URI should be accessible via Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS). The URI may also be a data URI.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.PixelOffsetWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the pixelOffset property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The pixelOffset property defines the offset, in viewport pixels, of the billboard origin from the `position`. A pixel offset is the number of pixels up and to the right to place the billboard, relative to the `position`.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.ScaleWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the scale property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The scale property defines the scale of the billboard. The scale is multiplied with the pixel size of the billboard's `image`. For example, if the scale is 2.0, the billboard will be rendered with twice the number of pixels, in each direction, of the `image`.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.RotationWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the rotation property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The rotation property defines the rotation of the billboard offset from the alignedAxes.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.AlignedAxisWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the alignedAxis property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The alignedAxis property defines the aligned axis is the unit vector, in world coordinates, that the billboard up vector points towards. The default is the zero vector, which means the billboard is aligned to the screen up vector.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.ShowWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the show property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The show property defines whether or not the billboard is shown.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.BillboardCesiumWriter.VerticalOriginWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the verticalOrigin property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The verticalOrigin property defines the vertical origin of the billboard. It controls whether the billboard image is bottom-, center-, or top-aligned with the `position`.

member.summary: Writes the multiplier property. The multiplier property specifies the multiplier, which in TICK_DEPENDENT mode is the number of seconds to advance each tick. In SYSTEM_CLOCK_DEPENDENT mode, it is the multiplier applied to the amount of time elapsed between ticks. This value is ignored in SYSTEM_CLOCK mode.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.ClockCesiumWriter.WriteRange(CesiumLanguageWriter.ClockRange)
member.summary: Writes the range property. The range property specifies the behavior of a clock when its current time reaches its start or end points. Valid values are 'UNBOUNDED', 'CLAMPED', and 'LOOP_STOP'.
member.param: The clock range.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.ClockCesiumWriter.WriteStep(CesiumLanguageWriter.ClockStep)
member.summary: Writes the step property. The step property specifies defines how a clock steps in time. Valid values are 'SYSTEM_CLOCK', 'SYSTEM_CLOCK_MULTIPLIER', and 'TICK_DEPENDENT'.
member.param: The clock step.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.ColorCesiumWriter.WriteRgba(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Writes the rgba property. The rgba property specifies the color specified as an array of color components [Red, Green, Blue, Alpha] where each component is in the range 0-255. If the array has four elements, the color is constant. If it has five or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as [Time, Red, Green, Blue, Alpha, Time, Red, Green, Blue, Alpha, ...], where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since epoch.
member.param: The color.

member.summary: Writes the axes property. The axes property specifies tODO

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.DirectionCesiumWriter.WriteSpherical(CesiumLanguageWriter.Spherical)
member.summary: Writes the spherical property. The spherical property specifies a direction specified as a spherical [Clock, Cone, Magnitude] angles in radians, distance in meters. If the array has three elements, the direction is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as [Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, ...], where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since epoch.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.DirectionCesiumWriter.WriteSpherical(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Spherical})
member.summary: Writes the spherical property. The spherical property specifies a direction specified as a spherical [Clock, Cone, Magnitude] angles in radians, distance in meters. If the array has three elements, the direction is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as [Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, Time, Clock, Cone, Magnitude, ...], where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since epoch.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.DirectionCesiumWriter.WriteSpherical(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Spherical},System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.
The index of the first element to use in the `values` collection.
The number of elements to use from the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.DirectionCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the direction represented as a unit Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]`. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.DoubleCesiumWriter.WriteNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes the number property. The number property specifies the floating-point value. The value may be a single number, in which case the value is constant over the interval, or it may be an array. If it is an array and the array has one element, the value is constant over the interval. If it has two or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as [Time, Value, Time, Value, ...], where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since epoch.
member.param: The value.

If it has two or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as [Time, Value, Time, Value, ...], where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since epoch.
member.param: The dates at which the value is specified.
The value corresponding to each date.
The index of the first element to use in the `values` collection.
The number of elements to use from the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.EllipsoidRadiiCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the radii as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in meters. If the array has three elements, the radii are constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.EllipsoidRadiiCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the radii as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in meters. If the array has three elements, the radii are constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.EyeOffsetCesiumWriter
member.summary: Writes a EyeOffset to a . A EyeOffset defines an offset in eye coordinates which can optionally vary over time. Eye coordinates are a left-handed coordinate system where the X-axis points toward the viewer's right, the Y-axis poitns up, and the Z-axis points into the screen.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.EyeOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the eye offset specified as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` position in eye coordinates in meters. If the array has three elements, the eye offset is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.EyeOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the eye offset specified as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` position in eye coordinates in meters. If the array has three elements, the eye offset is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.EyeOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian},System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.
The index of the first element to use in the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.LabelCesiumWriter.OpenEyeOffsetProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the eyeOffset property. The eyeOffset property defines the eye offset of the label, which is the offset in eye coordinates at which to place the label relative to the `position` property. Eye coordinates are a left-handed coordinate system where the X-axis points toward the viewer's right, the Y-axis points up, and the Z-axis points into the screen.

member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.LabelCesiumWriter.OpenScaleProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the scale property. The scale property defines the scale of the label. The scale is multiplied with the pixel size of the label's text. For example, if the scale is 2.0, the label will be rendered with twice the number of pixels, in each direction, of the text.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.LabelCesiumWriter.EyeOffsetWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the eyeOffset property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The eyeOffset property defines the eye offset of the label, which is the offset in eye coordinates at which to place the label relative to the `position` property. Eye coordinates are a left-handed coordinate system where the X-axis points toward the viewer's right, the Y-axis points up, and the Z-axis points into the screen.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteId(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the id property. The id property specifies the ID of the object described by this packet. IDs do not need to be GUIDs, but they do need to uniquely identify a single object within a CZML source and any other CZML sources loaded into the same scope. If this property is not specified, the client will automatically generate a unique one. However, this prevents later packets from referring to this object in order to, for example, add more data to it.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteName(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the name property. The name property specifies the name of the object. It does not have to be unique and is intended for user consumption.
member.param: The value.

member.summary: Writes the parent property. The parent property specifies the ID of the parent object or folder.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteAvailability(CesiumLanguageWriter.TimeInterval)
member.summary: Writes the availability property. The availability property specifies when data for an object is available. If data for an object is known to be available at the current animation time, but the client does not yet have that data (presumably because it will arrive in a later packet), the client will pause with a message like "Buffering..." while it waits to receive the data. The property can be a single string specifying a single interval, or an array of strings representing intervals. A later Cesium packet can update this availability if it changes or is found to be incorrect. For example, an SGP4 propagator may report availability for all time, but then later the propagator throws an exception and the availability needs to be adjusted. If this optional property is not present, the object is assumed to be available for all time. Availability is scoped to a particular CZML stream, so two different streams can list different availability for a single object. Within a single stream, the last availability stated for an object is the one in effect and any availabilities in previous packets are ignored. If an object is available at a time, the client expects the object to have at least one property, and it expects all properties that it needs to be defined at that time. If the object doesn't have any properties, or a needed property is defined but not at the animation time, the client will pause animation and wait for more data.
member.param: The interval.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteAvailability(CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate,CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate)
member.summary: Writes the availability property. The availability property specifies when data for an object is available. If data for an object is known to be available at the current animation time, but the client does not yet have that data (presumably because it will arrive in a later packet), the client will pause with a message like "Buffering..." while it waits to receive the data. The property can be a single string specifying a single interval, or an array of strings representing intervals. A later Cesium packet can update this availability if it changes or is found to be incorrect. For example, an SGP4 propagator may report availability for all time, but then later the propagator throws an exception and the availability needs to be adjusted. If this optional property is not present, the object is assumed to be available for all time. Availability is scoped to a particular CZML stream, so two different streams can list different availability for a single object. Within a single stream, the last availability stated for an object is the one in effect and any availabilities in previous packets are ignored. If an object is available at a time, the client expects the object to have at least one property, and it expects all properties that it needs to be defined at that time. If the object doesn't have any properties, or a needed property is defined but not at the animation time, the client will pause animation and wait for more data.
member.param: The earliest date of the interval.
The latest date of the interval.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenBillboardProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the billboard property. The billboard property defines a billboard, or viewport-aligned image. The billboard is positioned in the scene by the position property. A billboard is sometimes called a marker.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenPointProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the point property. The point property defines a point, or viewport-aligned circle. The point is positioned in the scene by the `position` property.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenLabelProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the label property. The label property defines a string of text. The label is positioned in the scene by the `position` property.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenPolylineProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the polyline property. The polyline property defines a polyline, which is a line in the scene composed of multiple segments.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenPathProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the path property. The path property defines a path, which is a polyline defined by the motion of an object over time. The possible vertices of the path are specified by the `position` property.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenPolygonProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the polygon property. The polygon property defines a polygon, which is a closed figure on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenEllipsoidProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the ellipsoid property. The ellipsoid property defines an ellipsoid, which is a closed quadric surface that is a three dimensional analogue of an ellipse. The ellipsoid is positioned and oriented using the `position` and `orientation` properties.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteViewFrom(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the viewFrom property. The viewFrom property specifies a suggested camera location when viewing this object. The property is specified as a Cartesian position in the East (x), North (y), Up (z) reference frame relative to the objects position property.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteViewFrom(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the viewFrom property. The viewFrom property specifies a suggested camera location when viewing this object. The property is specified as a Cartesian position in the East (x), North (y), Up (z) reference frame relative to the objects position property.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteViewFrom(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian},System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

The number of elements to use from the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenModelProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the model property. The model property defines a 3D model. The model is positioned and oriented using the `position` and `orientation` properties.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenEllipseProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the ellipse property. The ellipse property defines an ellipse, which is a closed curve on the surface of the Earth. The ellipse is positioned using the `position` property.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenClockProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the clock property. The clock property defines the clock settings for the entire data set. Only valid on the document object.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.WriteVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the version property. The version property specifies the CZML version being written. Only valid on the document object.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenConicSensorProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the agi_conicSensor property. The agi_conicSensor property defines a conical sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenCustomPatternSensorProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the agi_customPatternSensor property. The agi_customPatternSensor property defines a custom sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenFanProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the agi_fan property. The agi_fan property defines defines a fan, which starts at a point or apex and extends in a specified list of directions from the apex. Each pair of directions forms a face of the fan extending to the specified radius.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenRectangularSensorProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the agi_rectangularSensor property. The agi_rectangularSensor property defines a rectangular pyramid sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OpenVectorProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the agi_vector property. The agi_vector property defines defines a graphical vector that originates at the `position` property and extends in the provided direction for the provided length.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.DescriptionWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the description property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The description property defines an HTML description of the object.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.PositionWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the position property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The position property defines the position of the object in the world. The position has no direct visual representation, but it is used to locate billboards, labels, and other primitives attached to the object.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.BillboardWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the billboard property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The billboard property defines a billboard, or viewport-aligned image. The billboard is positioned in the scene by the position property. A billboard is sometimes called a marker.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.OrientationWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the orientation property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The orientation property defines the orientation of the object in the world. The orientation has no direct visual representation, but it is used to orient models, cones, and pyramids attached to the object.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.PointWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the point property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The point property defines a point, or viewport-aligned circle. The point is positioned in the scene by the `position` property.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.LabelWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the label property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The label property defines a string of text. The label is positioned in the scene by the `position` property.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.PolylineWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the polyline property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The polyline property defines a polyline, which is a line in the scene composed of multiple segments.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.PathWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the path property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The path property defines a path, which is a polyline defined by the motion of an object over time. The possible vertices of the path are specified by the `position` property.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.PolygonWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the polygon property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The polygon property defines a polygon, which is a closed figure on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.EllipsoidWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the ellipsoid property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The ellipsoid property defines an ellipsoid, which is a closed quadric surface that is a three dimensional analogue of an ellipse. The ellipsoid is positioned and oriented using the `position` and `orientation` properties.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.ModelWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the model property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The model property defines a 3D model. The model is positioned and oriented using the `position` and `orientation` properties.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.EllipseWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the ellipse property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The ellipse property defines an ellipse, which is a closed curve on the surface of the Earth. The ellipse is positioned using the `position` property.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.ClockWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the clock property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The clock property defines the clock settings for the entire data set. Only valid on the document object.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.ConicSensorWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the agi_conicSensor property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The agi_conicSensor property defines a conical sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.CustomPatternSensorWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the agi_customPatternSensor property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The agi_customPatternSensor property defines a custom sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.FanWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the agi_fan property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The agi_fan property defines defines a fan, which starts at a point or apex and extends in a specified list of directions from the apex. Each pair of directions forms a face of the fan extending to the specified radius.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.RectangularSensorWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the agi_rectangularSensor property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The agi_rectangularSensor property defines a rectangular pyramid sensor volume taking into account occlusion of an ellipsoid, i.e., the globe.

member.name: P:CesiumLanguageWriter.PacketCesiumWriter.VectorWriter
member.summary: Gets the writer for the agi_vector property. The returned instance must be opened by calling the method before it can be used for writing. The agi_vector property defines defines a graphical vector that originates at the `position` property and extends in the provided direction for the provided length.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.PathCesiumWriter
member.summary: Writes a Path to a . A Path a path, which is a polyline defined by the motion of an object over time. The possible vertices of the path are specified by the `position` property.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PathCesiumWriter.OpenResolutionProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the resolution property. The resolution property defines the maximum step-size, in seconds, used to sample the path. If the `position` property has data points farther apart than resolution specfies, additional steps will be taken, creating a smoother path.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.PixelOffsetCesiumWriter
member.summary: Writes a PixelOffset to a . A PixelOffset defines a pixel offset in viewport coordinates. A pixel offset is the number of pixels up and to the right to place an element relative to an origin.

member.summary: The name of the cartesian2 property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance as a copy of an existing instance.
member.param: The existing instance to copy.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PixelOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian2(CesiumLanguageWriter.Rectangular)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian2 property. The cartesian2 property specifies the pixel offset specified as a Cartesian `[X, Y]` in viewport coordinates in pixels, where X is pixels to the right and Y is pixels up. If the array has two elements, the pixel offset is constant. If it has three or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PixelOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian2(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian2 property. The cartesian2 property specifies the pixel offset specified as a Cartesian `[X, Y]` in viewport coordinates in pixels, where X is pixels to the right and Y is pixels up. If the array has two elements, the pixel offset is constant. If it has three or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The X component.
The Y component.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PixelOffsetCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian2(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Rectangular})
member.summary: Writes the cartesian2 property. The cartesian2 property specifies the pixel offset specified as a Cartesian `[X, Y]` in viewport coordinates in pixels, where X is pixels to the right and Y is pixels up. If the array has two elements, the pixel offset is constant. If it has three or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, Time, X, Y, ...]`, where _Time_ is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteReferenceFrame(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the referenceFrame property. The referenceFrame property specifies the reference frame in which cartesian positions are specified. Possible values are "FIXED" and "INERTIAL". In addition, the value of this property can be a hash (#) symbol followed by the ID of another object in the same scope whose "position" and "orientation" properties define the reference frame in which this position is defined. This property is ignored when specifying position with any type other than cartesian. If this property is not specified, the default reference frame is "FIXED".
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the position represented as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in the meters relative to the `referenceFrame`. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the position represented as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in the meters relative to the `referenceFrame`. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartesian(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the cartesian property. The cartesian property specifies the position represented as a Cartesian `[X, Y, Z]` in the meters relative to the `referenceFrame`. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, Time, X, Y, Z, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the vector is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.
The index of the first element to use in the `values` collection.
The number of elements to use from the `values` collection.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartographicRadians(CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartographic)
member.summary: Writes the cartographicRadians property. The cartographicRadians property specifies the position represented as a WGS 84 Cartographic `[Longitude, Latitude, Height]` where longitude and latitude are in radians and height is in meters. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, Longitude, Latitude, Height, Time, Longitude, Latitude, Height, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The interval.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartographicRadians(System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate},System.Collections.Generic.IList{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartographic})
member.summary: Writes the cartographicRadians property. The cartographicRadians property specifies the position represented as a WGS 84 Cartographic `[Longitude, Latitude, Height]` where longitude and latitude are in radians and height is in meters. If the array has three elements, the position is constant. If it has four or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, Longitude, Latitude, Height, Time, Longitude, Latitude, Height, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The dates at which the position is specified.
The values corresponding to each date.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.PositionCesiumWriter.WriteCartesianVelocity(CesiumLanguageWriter.Motion{CesiumLanguageWriter.Cartesian})
member.summary: Writes the cartesianVelocity property. The cartesianVelocity property specifies the position and velocity represented as two Cartesians `[X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ]` in the meters relative to the `referenceFrame`. If the array has six elements, the position is constant. If it has seven or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.
member.param: The value.

If it has seven or more elements, they are time-tagged samples arranged as `[Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, Time, X, Y, Z, vX, vY, vZ, ...]`, where Time is an ISO 8601 date and time string or seconds since `epoch`.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.StripeMaterialCesiumWriter.OpenOffsetProperty
member.summary: Opens and returns the writer for the offset property. The offset property defines the value indicating where in the pattern to begin drawing; with 0.0 being the beginning of the even color, 1.0 the beginning of the odd color, 2.0 being the even color again, and any multiple or fractional values being in between.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.GregorianDate
member.summary: Represents a calendar date in the Gregorian calendar. A does not include a as does. However, without explicitly specifying a for the date, the is assumed to be represented in . is also capable of representing leap seconds, which are represented as the second measured from 60 to 61. In this case, the is assumed to be the represented in which can represent leap seconds exactly.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.GregorianDate.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a from the provided values.
member.param: The year.
The month of the year (in the range 1 through 12)
The day of the month (in the range 1 through the number of days in )
The hour (in the range 0 through 23).
The minute (in the range 0 through 59).

The second, including fractional seconds (in the range 0.0 up to, but not including, 61.0). A second between 60.0 and 61.0 (a leap second) is only valid if the overall time is during one of the official leap seconds.
member.exception: Thrown when one of the provided parameters is outside of its acceptable range.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.GregorianDate.Parser
member.summary:
This class was taken from the Mono class, and substantially altered to fit the needs of Gregorian Date. Gregorian Date assumes UTC, so all time-zone handling was ripped out. The "f" parsing was also changed to allow more precision than the 7 digits that mandates.
Note: any comment from here on is taken from the Mono source, so any references to bug numbers refer to their bugs.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate
member.summary: An astronomical Julian Date, which is the number of days since noon on January 1, -4712 (4713 BC). For increased precision, this class stores the whole number part of the date as an and the seconds into the day as a .
member.remarks: This type assumes that days always have (86400.0) seconds. When using a with the (UTC) time standard, a day with a leap second actually has 86401.0 seconds. The end result is that cannot represent the moment of a leap second with the UTC time standard. It CAN represent the moment of a leap second in (TAI), however. Also, subtracting two UTC dates that are on opposite sides of a leap second will correctly take the leap second into account.

member.summary: Computes the number of seconds that have elapsed from this Julian date to the Julian date.
member.param: The other Julian date, which is the end of the interval.
member.returns: The number of seconds that have elapsed from this Julian date to the other Julian date.
member.remarks: This method subtracts the Julian date on which it is called from the Julian date and returns the number of seconds between them. The computation is done in the time standard of this Julian date, or the closest standard that is safe for arithmetic if this Julian date's time standard is not safe. For best performance, this Julian date and the Julian date should have the same time standard and it should be safe for arithmetic.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.LeapSecond
member.summary: Describes a single leap second.
member.remarks: The International Earth Rotation Service (IERS) periodically introduces an intercalary adjustment to the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time scale in order to keep it in close agreement with the Universal Time (UT1) time scale. This adjustment amounts to a one second discontinuity, a leap second, in the UTC time scale that, in addition to the UT1 time scales, also affects transformations to other continuous time scales. Since the inception of leap seconds, all adjustments have been performed either at the end of 30 June or 31 December UTC though a leap second could, by rule, be applied at the end of any month.

member.name: T:CesiumLanguageWriter.Reference
member.summary:
Represents a link to another property. References can be used to specify that two properties on different objects are in fact, the same property. This also has the added benefit of cutting down on CZML file size.
The formatted reference string contains the identifier of the target object followed by a hashtag (#) and one or more property names, each separated by a period (.). Any hash symbols or periods that exist in the reference identifier or property must be properly escaped with a backslash (\\) in order for the reference to be valid.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from an escaped reference string.
member.param: The reference string.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from an identifier and property.
member.param: The identifier of the object which contains the referenced property.
The property on the referenced object.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from an identifier and a list of properties.
member.param: The identifier of the object which contains the referenced property.
A list of property names with each property being a sub-property of the previous one.

member.returns: The escaped CZML value of the reference.

member.name: M:CesiumLanguageWriter.YearMonthDay.GetAdjustedJulianDayNumber(CesiumLanguageWriter.JulianDate)
member.summary:
The constructor taking an integer Julian day number assumes that the desired should represent the Gregorian day corresponding to the beginning of the provided Julian day number. If the is more than one half day later than that, the calculation will be wrong.
So, if is more than 12 hours past the start of the Julian day, we instead use the Julian date number of tomorrow.
member.param: The date.
member.returns: The Julian day number that will produce the correct Gregorian day number.
